Yoruba: Àwọn kan lọ ń gbé ní iléèwé tí wọ́n ṣètò pé káwọn èèyàn sá sí, àwọn míì sì lọ ń gbé ní ilé àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà bíi tiwọn.
English: They were accommodated either in schools, which are being used as shelters, or in the homes of fellow Witnesses.

Yoruba: Bí gbogbo òṣìṣẹ́ lágbàáyé se ń sàmì àyájó àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ní gbogbo ìpele láti ṣe ètò ilé olówópókú ,ètò ìlera tó jíire lówó tí kò ganilára àti sísan owó Àjemọ́nú àwọn òṣìṣẹ̀ fẹ̀hìntì lásìkò.

Yoruba: Àṣìṣe wáyé ní ṣíṣàfihàn wúnrẹ̀n yìí

English: That does not make me a killer anyway

English: For me, it's not only about not wanting to be all things to all men; we simply don't have the capacity to be all things to all men.

English: By Sunday, the hurricane had been downgraded to a tropical storm but continued to devastate southeast Texas through Wednesday, August 30.

Yoruba: Tìẹ ni

Yoruba: Orílẹ̀ èdè India ti pèsè ètò ìrànlọ́wọ́ fún Nàíjíríà nípa gbígbógun ti ikọ̀ ọlọ̀tẹ̀ Boko Haram.
English: India stands together with Nigeria in its fight against Boko Hatam.

English: We admire the calm endurance of Brother Christensen in the face of this ongoing injustice.

English: Please ask these gentlemen who are sitting in the hall if they would like to share their wife with somebody else.

English: Serena was playing in her first tournament since giving birth last September and faced her sister for the 29th time, with Venus winning all but four of their meetings.

English: Local authorities suspect arsonists may have started some of the fires.

Yoruba: Síbè̩, ènìyàn borí níwò̩n, kùnà níwò̩n.

English: She told me she was terrified that Boko Haram would come back for her.

Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ àsọkẹ́yìn tó sọ nílé ẹjọ́ ní ọjọ́ díẹ̀ ṣáájú ọjọ́ tí wọ́n dájọ́ rẹ̀, Arákùnrin Christensen sọ pé: “Bópẹ́ bóyá, ohun tó jẹ́ òótọ́ máa hàn kedere, bó sì ṣe máa rí nínú ẹjọ́ yìí náà nìyẹn.”
English: Just days before the final verdict, while delivering his final statement to the court, Brother Christensen noted: “The truth sooner or later becomes obvious, and it will be the case in this matter.”

English: For schools, educational programs, organizations, or other group learning settings that will share the use of Kolibri

English: India says it is ready to strengthen bilateral relations with Nigeria in the areas of Trade and investments, Security, Education, Aviation and medical tourism for the benefit of both countries.

English: We pray for all of our faithful and courageous brothers and sisters in Russia that they ‘may be strengthened with all power according to [Jehovah’s] glorious might so that [they] may endure fully with patience and joy.’—Colossians 1:11."

Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù ọ̀dọ́ Guingamp tó ń kópa nínú ìdíje orílẹ̀-èdè Faransé, tọ́jọ́ orí wọn kò ju mọ́kàndínlógún lọ, Guingamp U19 ti ra Isaac Drogba, ọmọ atamátàsé ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù Chelsea tẹ́lẹ̀rí, tí ó tún jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Cote dIvoire, Didier Drogba wá sínú ikọ̀ náà báyìí.
English: The young Guingamp footballer who are not more than sixteen years  playing in the French league contracted Isaac Drogba, the former Chelsea striker son, who is also a citizen of Cote divoire, Didier Drogba into the team now.

Yoruba: Ẹní gbé adíẹ òtòṣì-í gbé ti aláròyé.

Yoruba: Àwọn kan nínú wa máa ń bọ́ nínú ewu ibà-ìgbóná; a máa ń móríbọ́ nínú àrùn kògbóògùn AIDS.
English: Some of us do survive malaria; we do survive AIDS.

Yoruba: Ààrẹ Buhari tún wá gbósùbà fún ààrẹ, José Mário Vaz, tó ń sẹ̀sẹ̀ ń fi ipò sílẹ̀ fún àtìlẹyìn tí o sé fún ààrẹ tuntun ọ̀hún lásìkò ètò ìdìbò.
English: President Buhari commended the out-going President, José Mário Vaz, himself a candidate in the elections for supporting the emergence of Embalo in the second round of balloting “in the interest of peace and stability.”

English: Whoever knows what darkness can do must not antagonize the moon; one's actions “sometimes” send one abroad at night; roaming around in the dark is not a becoming habit.

English: Liverpool chief coach, Jurgen Klopp has commended his team after defeatin g their counterpart Manchester City out of the UEFA champions League with two goals to one (2-1), to qualify for the semi finals of the game.

Yoruba: Ibi Tó Ti Wáyé: Chase Field ní Phoenix, Arizona, Orílẹ̀-èdè Amẹ́ríkà
English: Location: Chase Field in Phoenix, Arizona, United States

Yoruba: Ó wá gba ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà níyànjú pé kí wọ́n “ṣàyẹ̀wò òfin tó dá lórí Bí Wọ́n Ṣe Lè Gbéjà Ko Àwọn Agbawèrèmẹ́sìn kí wọ́n lè ṣàtúnṣe sí ìtumọ̀ tí wọ́n fún ọ̀rọ̀ náà ‘agbawèrèmẹ́sìn,’ kí wọ́n sì rí i dájú pé àwọn alákatakítí tó ń hùwà jàgídíjàgan ni wọ́n kà sí agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.”
English: She urged the Russian government “to revise the Federal Law on Combating Extremist Activity with a view to clarifying the vague and open-ended definition of ‘extremist activity,’ and ensuring that the definition requires an element of violence or hatred.”

English: As Russian authorities continue to fabricate lies to discredit our reputation as peace-loving people, we recall the words of Jesus, who foretold that opposers would “lyingly say every sort of wicked thing against” his disciples.—Matthew 5:11."

Yoruba: Ìgbésẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ìṣísílẹ̀-gbangba-wálíà, tí ó ju àwọn àṣẹ CC lọ, jẹ́ àgbáríjọ àwọn ènìyàn tí ó gbà wí pé ilé-ayé sànjù bí a bá pín iṣẹ́ àti ṣiṣẹ́ papọ̀ ní ìṣọ̀kan.
English: The open movement, which extends beyond just CC licenses, is a global force of people committed to the idea that the world is better when we share and work together.

English: The pioneers have shown a courageous spirit and are eager to continue public witnessing.

English: Now loosing the trouphy  of the game into the hand of the Chelsea, shows that Manchester football team ended this season without any trouphy.

English: Thank you to the club, the fans, the team, the coach, the staff and everybody who shared with me this part of my history,”

English: In the meantime, all six remain under travel and other restrictions.

Yoruba: O yẹ kí ó wà
English: I'm sure there should be

Yoruba: Ṣùgbọ́n, máà fòyà! Ìgbésẹ̀ ni ààbò, àti pé nípasẹ̀ àlàálẹ̀ tó p'ójú òṣùwọ̀n, o lè ṣe ìdíyelé ohun tí ó dára fún ọ.
English: But, do not fear! Security is a process, and through thoughtful planning, you can assess what’s right for you.

English: You’ll learn a lot more about copyright later in the course, but for now it’s enough to know that copyright is an area of law that regulates the way the products of human creativity are used - like books, academic research articles, music, and art.

Yoruba: Ọ̀mọ̀rán bèèrè ọ̀ràn wò; Ìjàpá ní, “Ẹni tí wọ́n pa lánàá, kàà kú tán?”
English: The sage asks for information; Àjàpá the trickster asks, “About the person who was killed yesterday, is he already dead?”

Yoruba: Èmi Esther ni
English: It's me Esther

English: The brothers in the affected areas remain alert to the continued threat of landslides if there is more rainfall.

Yoruba: Inú àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa máa dùn láti rí orúkọ Jèhófà ní gbogbo ibi tó yẹ kó wà.”

Yoruba: Ibi tí a ní kí gbégbé má gbèé, ibẹ̀ ní ń gbé.

Yoruba: Ò tún rọ̀ àwọn ará ìlú láti mágba àdúrà fún Orílẹ̀ èdè wa láti lo àsìkò yìí láti gbàdúrà fún àlááfíà àti ìṣòkan Nigeria.
English: He also enjoined the faithful to use this season to pray for peace, prosperity and unity of Nigeria.

Yoruba: Àpẹẹrẹ ọ̀tá ni ọ̀gáà rẹ, olólùfẹ́ẹ̀ rẹ ti tẹ́lẹ̀, oníṣòwò ẹlẹgbẹ́ẹ rẹ̀, ìjọbaà rẹ, tàbí olè orí-ayélujára lórí ìṣàsopọ̀ gbogboògbò.
English: Examples of potential adversaries are your boss, your former partner, your business competition, your government, or a hacker on a public network.

Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ tí èmi àti olùṣèwádìí jọ sọ, ó túbọ̀ ṣe kedere pé torí pé mo gba Jèhófà, Ọlọ́run Olódùmarè gbọ́ mo sì ń lo orúkọ rẹ̀ nínú àdúrà àti ọ̀rọ̀ mi ni wọ́n ṣe mú mi tí wọ́n sì fi mí sí àtìmọ́lé.
English: From my conversations with the investigator, it became even more evident that I was arrested and held in custody because I am a believer who uses the name of the Almighty God, Jehovah, in my prayers and speech.

Yoruba: Iṣu àtẹnumọ́ kì í jóná; ọ̀kà àtẹnumọ́ kì í mẹrẹ; àwòdì kì í gbé adìẹ à-tẹnu-kunkun-mọ́.
English: The yam one does not stop speaking about will not get burnt; the corn-meal one speaks constantly about does not become too well-done; a chicken that is the subject of constant caution does not get snatched up by a hawk.

Yoruba: Ìròyìn ti gbé e, wọ́n ti dájọ́ fún un
English: It's all over the news he has been convicted

Yoruba: Mo gbà pé ọ̀nà tá a gbà tọ́jú àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà láti àádọ́ta (50) ọdún sẹ́yìn ti mú káwọn dókítà mọ bí wọ́n ò ṣe ní jẹ́ kí ẹ̀jẹ̀ ṣòfò nígbà tí wọ́n bá ń ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ àti bí wọ́n ṣe lè ṣiṣẹ́ abẹ láìlo ẹ̀jẹ̀.”​—⁠Giandomenico Biancofiore, tó jẹ́ olùdarí iṣẹ́ abẹ tó díjú ní ẹ̀ka anesthesia and resuscitation in transplants ní Pisa University Hospital, òun sì ni igbákejì ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n ní ẹ̀ka anesthesiology and resuscitation ní University of Pisa
English: I think that the treatment of Jehovah’s Witness patients over the past 50 years has led clinicians to greater awareness of blood conservation and of the progress in bloodless surgery.”—Giandomenico Biancofiore, director of the complex operative unit of anesthesia and resuscitation in transplants at the Pisa University Hospital, associate professor of anesthesiology and resuscitation at the University of Pisa

English: --- Thank you! – Mikel appreciates police for rescuing his father

English: At the end of the day, the court announced that the hearing will resume on Thursday, May 16, when closing arguments will begin.

Yoruba: Bí kò bá sí Boca, kò bá tí sí ọ̀nà mìíràn tí n ó gbé èyí gbà tí ọ̀pọ̀ ènìyàn ó sì gbọ́ mi tó báyìí.
English: If it weren't for Boca, I wouldn't have any other way to do this and be heard by so many people.

Yoruba: Sàràkí múu dá wọn lójú pé ìgbà ọ̀tun ńbò ṣùgbọ́n ki àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ o ri dájú pé wọn n sa ipá wọn pàápá lẹ́nu isẹ́ òòjó wọn.
English: Saraki expressed hope that workers would be encouraged therefore they should always put in their best.

Yoruba: "Àwùjọ àwọn onímọ̀ ìjìnlẹ̀ kan tó ń rí sí ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn lábẹ́ Àjọ Ìṣọ̀kan Àgbáyé kọ ìwé kan tó ní ojú ìwé mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún (15). Nínú ìwé náà, wọ́n sọ pé ìjọba Rọ́ṣíà ti tẹ òfin àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè lójú, bí wọ́n ṣe fi àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà méjìdínlógún (18) sátìmọ́lé láwọn ìlú ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀, láti May 2018 sí July 2019. Wọ́n ní kí àwọn aláṣẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́síà dá àwọn ará wa tó wà látìmọ́lé sílẹ̀ lẹ́sẹ̀kẹsẹ̀, kí wọ́n sì máa lọ lómìnira.
English: "A United Nations (UN) panel of human rights experts has issued a 15-page opinion concluding that Russia violated international law by arresting and detaining 18 Jehovah’s Witnesses in different cities from May 2018 to July 2019. Ultimately, the panel demands the immediate and unconditional release of those Witnesses who are still detained.

Yoruba: Kín ni ìdí tí CC ṣe di igi àràbà tí gbogbo àgbáyé ń bá ṣe?
English: Why has CC grown into a global movement?

Yoruba: "Ní March 25, 2020, Ilé Ẹjọ́ Kòtẹ́milọ́rùn tó wà nílùú Penza fagi lé ìpinnu tí ilé ẹjọ́ kan ṣe níbi ìgbẹ́jọ́ Arákùnrin Vladimir Alushkin, Vladimir Kulyasov, Andrey Magliv àti Arákùnrin Denis Timoshin pa pọ̀ pẹ̀lú Arábìnrin Tatyana Alushkina àti Galiya Olkhova.
English: "On March 25, 2020, the Penza Regional Court overturned the conviction of Brothers Vladimir Alushkin, Vladimir Kulyasov, Andrey Magliv, and Denis Timoshin, as well as Sisters Tatyana Alushkina and Galiya Olkhova.

Yoruba: Ní June 20, 2018, Àjọ Tó Ń Rí sí Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn ní Rọ́ṣíà sọ pé kí Ọ́fíìsì Olùpẹ̀jọ́ Ìjọba ṣèwádìí bóyá ó bófin mu láti máa fi àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà sẹ́wọ̀n torí ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́.
English: On June 20, 2018, Russia’s Human Rights Council requested that the Prosecutor General’s Office verify the lawfulness of the criminal prosecution of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

Yoruba: Ìgbé ayé ìbálòpọ̀ wa ò lárinrin mọ́
English: Our sex life is boring

Yoruba: Nígbà tí a bẹ̀rẹ̀, a ò rí ojú-òpó-ìsopọ̀ ayélukára-bí-ajere tó ṣe é gbáralé láti ta àtagbà ìwífún-alálàyé, pàápàá jùlọ láti àwọn ilé-ìwòsàn tí wọ́n wà ní ìgbèríko.
English: When we started, we didn't find a reliable network to transmit data, especially from rural hospitals.

Yoruba: Gbogbo àwọn tó sọ̀rọ̀ níbi ìpàdé náà ló gbèjà àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, wọ́n sọ pé èèyàn àlàáfíà ni wọ́n, wọn kì í sì í dá wàhálà sílẹ̀ nílùú.
English: All on the panel defended Jehovah’s Witnesses as a peaceful people who pose no threat to society.

Yoruba: Ta ni mo fẹ́ fi pamọ́ fún?
English: Who do I want to protect it from?

Yoruba: A kì í pa igún, a kì í jẹ igún, a kì í fi igún bọrí.
English: One does not kill the vulture; one does not eat the vulture; one does not offer the vulture as a sacrifice to one's head.

Yoruba: Etí tó gbọ́ àlọ ni yó gbọ̀ọ́ àbọ̀.
English: The same ears that heard about the departure will hear about the return.

Yoruba: Ọ̀tùnba Dẹngẹ nígbà tó ń kí Gómìnà tó kógbá wọlé, ìyẹn Akinwunmi Ambọde pé ìtẹ̀síwájú rẹ̀ á dára àti pé Sanwó-Olú yóò ma tẹ̀síwájú nínú àlàálẹ̀ Asíwáju wọn.
English: Otunba Anifowosoe while wishing outgoing Governor Mr. Akinwunmi Ambode well in future endeavours said that Mr. Sanwo-Olu would continue from where he stopped to build on the legacy of the founding fathers of Lagos State.

Yoruba: Fẹ́nu kò mí lẹ́nu
English: Kiss me

Yoruba: Nínú ìpinnu tí ìgbìmọ̀ WGAD ṣe ní October 2, 2017, wọ́n ní ìwà tí àwọn aláṣẹ orílẹ̀-èdè Kazakhstan hù kò dáa, wọ́n sì ní kí wọ́n tú Arákùnrin Akhmedov sílẹ̀.
English: In their opinion dated October 2, 2017, the WGAD condemned the actions of the Kazakh authorities and called for Brother Akhmedov’s release.

Yoruba: Àmọ́, kì í ṣe àwọn aláṣẹ ilé ẹjọ́ la gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé, Jèhófà la gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé.
English: However, we do not put our trust in human courts or officials—our trust remains in Jehovah.

Yoruba: Ẹni tí a bá ń bá nájà là ń wò, a kì í wo ariwo ọjà.
English: One pays attention to the person with whom one is bargaining, not to the commotion of the market place.

Ìdí nìyẹn tí ọ̀pọ̀ dókítà fi máa ń fa ẹ̀jẹ̀ síni lára.
English: There are definite advantages to the cost-benefit ratio of bloodless medicine.”—Diego Piazza, president of the Italian Medical Association of Catania, director of oncological surgery at the Garibaldi-Nesima Hospital of Catania, former president of the Italian Association of Hospital Surgeons (ACOI) “The apparent ‘harmless’ nature of blood transfusions, their perceived easy availability, their relatively low cost, the ease with which they can be prescribed, and the possibility to immediately observe their effectiveness (in terms of increased hemoglobin levels)—all these aspects have contributed to their widespread use.

English: The assertion was given by a member of the Green chambers representing Badagry Constituency at the National Assemblies. Mr. Bamgbose who stressed that as a member of the House, he has been able to also affect his constituents positively though various empowerment programmes, ranging from agriculture, crafts and many artisans within Badagry Federal Constituency. Mr. Bamgbose thanked Badagrians for giving him the opportunity to serve and promised to continue to deliver more dividends to his people.

Yoruba: Àmọ́, ìjì líle tó ṣọṣẹ́ ní Negros Occidental ba Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan jẹ́, ó sì ya lára òrùlé ilé náà lulẹ̀.
English: However, one Kingdom Hall in Negros Occidental suffered minor damage from strong winds that caused a portion of the ceiling to fall.

Yoruba: Apá kan nínú lẹ́tà náà sọ pé: “Ó wù mí kí n wà pẹ̀lú yín ní àpéjọ yìí, ṣùgbọ́n ìyẹn ò ṣeéṣe báyìí torí pé mi ò tíì parí iṣẹ́ tí a yàn fún mi.
English: Which said, in part: “I wish I could be gathered with you, but this is currently not possible since I have not yet completed my present assignment.

Yoruba: Arákùnrin Dean Jacek tó wà ní ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì ní Philippines sọ pé: “Bíbélì Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun tá a tún ṣe la mú jáde lédè Cebuano àti Tagalog.
English: Brother Dean Jacek, at the Philippines branch office, explains: “The Cebuano and Tagalog editions are revised versions of the New World Translation.

Yoruba: Láfikún sí èyí, ẹ̀ka ọ́fììsì tún ṣètò ìpàdé àkànṣe láti pèsè ìṣírí fún nǹkan bí 135 arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó ń ìwàásù níbi tí èrò pọ̀ sí ní Turku.
English: The branch also organized a special meeting to provide encouragement for the 135 brothers and sisters who assist with the metropolitan public witnessing in Turku.

Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ìròyìn àti àsà lórílè èdè Nàíjíríà, Lai Mohammed ti fẹ̀dùn ọkàn rẹ hàn lórí ikú olóògbé olóyè Alex Akinyele, tí ó jẹ́ mínísítà àná fún ìròyìn lórílè èdè Nàíjíríà.
English: Nigeria’s Minister of Information and Culture, Mr. Lai Mohammed, has expressed deep shock and sadness over the death of a former Minister of Information, Chief Alex Akinyele.

Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ń se ìpàdé pẹ̀lú àwọn adarí ilé –isẹ́ elétò ààbò lọ́wọ́-lọ́wọ́ báyìí nílé ààrẹ tó wà nílùú Àbújá.
English: Nigerian President, Muhammadu Buhari is currently presiding over a security briefing with Service Chiefs at the Presidential Villa in Abuja.

Yoruba: Ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Muhammadu Buhari ti forúkọ Kingsley Isitua Obiora ránsẹ́ sí ilé ìgbìmọ̀ asòfin àgbà gẹ́gẹ́ bí igbákejì gómìnà fún ilé-ìfowópamọ́ ti ìjọba àpapọ̀ (CBN).
English: President Muhammadu Buhari has sent the name of Dr Kingsley Isitua Obiora to the Senate for confirmation as Deputy Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria.

Yoruba: Fún ìdí yẹn, wọ́n fẹ̀sùn “ìwà ọ̀daràn tó burú jáì” kàn án, wọ́n sì pè é lẹ́jọ́ fún “ṣíṣètò ìgbòkègbodò àwọn agbawèrèmẹ́sìn.”
English: For this reason, he was accused of a “socially dangerous crime” and charged with “organizing the activities of an extremist organization.”

Yoruba: Bí ikún bá jẹ, bí ikún bá mu, ikún a wo oòrùn alẹ́.
English: When the squirrel has eaten, when the squirrel has drunk, the squirrel looks at the setting sun.

Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé àwọn ará wa tí ìjàǹbá iná yìí kàn ní Brazil kò ní jẹ́ kó sú wọn bí wọ́n ṣe ń gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé Jèhófà tó jẹ́ ‘ibi ààbò wa ní àkókò wàhálà.’—Sáàmù 9:9, 10.
English: We are confident that our brothers and sisters affected by this fire in Brazil will continue to trust in Jehovah, our “secure refuge in times of distress.”—Psalm 9:9, 10.

Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà tu àwọn ará yìí nínú kó sì fún wọn lókun kí wọ́n lè fara da àdánù ńlá yìí.​—Nọ́ńbà 6:26.
English: We pray that Jehovah will grant our brothers and sisters peace as they recover from this disaster.—Numbers 6:26.

Yoruba: Nígbà tí àwọn arákùnrin káàkiri ayé tó wá sí Rọ́ṣíà fi máa kúrò níbẹ̀, ìgbàgbọ́ wọn ti lágbára sí i, bí àwọn ará wọn ní Rọ́ṣíà ṣe pinnu pé àwọn ò ní fi Jèhófà sílẹ̀ gbé wọn ró gan-an, inú wọn sì dùn pé àwọn láǹfààní láti jẹ́rìí fáwọn aláṣẹ lọ́nà tó gbéṣẹ́.
English: The international delegation of brothers left Russia with their faith strengthened, heartened by their Russian brothers’ determination to remain loyal and the opportunity to give an effective witness to officials.

Yoruba: Iye Àwọn Tó Wá Láti Orílẹ̀-Èdè Míì: Ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́fà àti ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́ta (6,300)
English: Number of International Delegates: 6,300

Yoruba: Ṣé bí i àárọ̀, ọ̀sán, alẹ́?
English: Like morning, afternoon, night?

Yoruba: Àmọ́, ṣe ni ìrírí tó le koko táwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí ní yìí túbọ̀ mú kí wọ́n lágbára, wọ́n sì wá fìdí ẹ̀rí múlẹ̀ fáwọn èèyàn, (àti fún Ọlọ́run pàápàá), pé àwọn ni ẹ̀sìn Kristẹni kan ṣoṣo tó ta ko èròǹgbà tí Ìjọba Násì gbé lárugẹ.”
English: This harsh experience, however, has strengthened the movement, which presents itself to the judgment of history (and we believe, to the judgment of God) as the only Christian church that was opposed en masse to the idols of the Third Reich.

Yoruba: Kí á ṣá a ṣá a, kí á gbọ̀n ọ́n gbọ̀n ọ́n; ká fi oko eéran sílẹ̀ ló dá eéran lára.
English: One may slash at it and slash at it, and one may shake the sand from its roots for ever, but nothing affects the eéran grass like being abandoned.

Yoruba: Àwọn ará wa tó wà ní Lóvua ò lè lọ́ sí àwọn ìlú míì láti ṣe ìpàdé, torí wọ́n fòfin de àwọn tó wà ní ibùdó láti rìnrìn àjò.
English: Our brothers in Lóvua are unable to attend spiritual events in other cities, due to camp travel restrictions.

Yoruba: agbègbè olóòórùn àt'ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ ẹ̀fọn, àbí bẹ́ẹ̀kọ́?
English: smelly and mosquito-filled environments, aren’t they?

Yoruba: Ó fikún un pe, Àwọn agbábọ́ọ̀lù mi ti fi ara wọn hàn pé àwọn tó gbangba sùn lọ́yẹ́.
English: He added that, my playershave proved themselves that they are qualified.

Yoruba: --- Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Benue bọwọ́lu àbádòfin ètò ìsúná ọdún 2020.
English: --- Benue Governor signs 2020 budget

Yoruba: Bí eégún ó bàá wọlẹ̀, orò ni ń ṣe.
English: If a masquerader wishes to disappear into the ground, it cries “Orò!”

Yoruba: Elékèé lèké ń yè; oun a bá ṣe ní ń yéni.
English: Only a devious person knows what he or she is about; each person alone is privy to what he or she has done.

Yoruba: Níjọ́sí tí ó rí i lórí Ínsítágíráàmù, o ní o fẹ́ràn rẹ̀
English: The other day you saw it on Instagram, you said you liked it

Yoruba: Bí ó ti jẹ́ wí pé o kò leè fún ẹnikẹ́ni nímọ̀ràn ajẹmófin lẹ́yìn tí o bùṣe nínú ẹ̀kọ́ inú ìdá yìí, wà á ní ìmọ̀ kíkún tí kò ní ẹlẹ́gbẹ́ bí o bá parí abala-ẹ̀kọ́ yìí.
English: While you should not share legal advice to others based on course content, you will develop a high level of expertise upon completion of this course.

Yoruba: Ọ̀nà ọ̀fun, ọ̀nà ọ̀run: méjèèjì bákan náà ni wọ́n rí.
English: The pathway of the throat, the pathway to heaven: the two are very much alike.

Yoruba: A nílò láti máa gbé nínú ìrẹ́pọ̀ kí ìdàgbàsókè ó lè dé àgbègbè wa.
English: There is a need to maintain peaceful and cordial relationship and obedience to the constituted authorities to fast-track development in any society.

Yoruba: Olùdíje yóò wá láti orílè̩-èdè tó ń so̩ Gè̩é̩sì, ààre̩ CAF sò̩yí.
English: Candidates will come from the English-speaking group in CAF, the president says.

Yoruba: Àwọn omọdébìnrin inú wọn ní oore-ọ̀fẹ́ sí aṣọ ìlédìí ìsé-nǹkan-àlejò ti ètò kan fún ìpèsè àṣọ ìsé-nǹkan-àlejò.
English: Girls were able to access sanitary towels through an initiative to provide free sanitary towels.

Yoruba: Ọgbọ́n dùn-ún gbọ́n; ìmọ́ dùn-ún mọ̀.
English: Wisdom is a good thing to have; knowledge is a good thing to have.

Yoruba: Àbújá àti Port Harcourt ti ní ibùdó ọkọ̀ ojú òfurufú tuntun, bákan náà ni á ò tún tẹ̀síwájú láti se èyí ní ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó àti Kánò lọ́dún 2020.
English: Abuja and Port Harcourt have new international airport terminals, as will Kano and Lagos in 2020.

Yoruba: Àpèjọ àdúrà náà wáyé lásìkò ìgbéyàwó àbúrò ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari, Hajiya Hadiza Lawal àti Muhammad Tukur Ibrahim, tí ó wáyé ní Mọsalasi ìlú Àbújá, ní èyí tí ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari náà wà níbẹ̀.
English: The prayer session was conducted during a wedding Fathia attended by President Muhammadu Buhari between his niece, Hajiya Hadiza Lawal and Muhammad Tukur Ibrahim, at the National Mosque Abuja.

Yoruba: Kí á jìnnà séjò tí a ò bẹ́ lórí; ikú tí yó panni a jìnnà síni.
English: One should stand far back from a snake that has not been beheaded; the death that would kill one deserves a wide berth.

Yoruba: Ìdíje ọ̀hún ni ìrètí wà tẹ́lẹ̀ pé, yóò bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ nínú oṣù kẹta ọdún yìí, ṣùgbọ́n wọ́n sún un síwájú látàrí àfikún àwọn ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù mìíràn tí ó dara pọ̀ mọ́ ìdíje ọ̀hún.
English: The league was earlier scheduled to start on March 3, but the addition of new clubs led to a postponement.

Yoruba: Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí kan tiẹ̀ ti gbà láti kú kí wọ́n má bàá sẹ́ ìgbàgbọ́ wọn — Àmì “onígun mẹ́ta aláwọ̀ àlùkò” ló jẹ́ ẹ̀rí tó ṣeé fojú rí nípa àwọn tó ṣe irú ìpinnu bẹ́ẹ̀.
English: Some Witnesses have even sacrificed their lives in order not to renounce their faith—the “purple triangles” are a demonstration of this.

Yoruba: Agbábó̩̀ò̩lù amúlé, Akinfeev ti bó̩ò̩lù àgbáwo̩lé s̩ùgbó̩n Cavani tun gba wo̩lé ó sì jé̩ igbà àkó̩kó̩ tá mi àwò̩n nídìíje ò̩hún ní àádọ́rùn-ún iṣẹ́jú
English: Akinfeev made a save but Cavani fired in the rebound to open his account for the tournament from a yard out on 90 minutes.

Yoruba: Àwọn àdó olóró tí wọ́n lò kù nígbà Ogun Àgbáyé Kejì ni ohun ìjà tí wọ́n láwọn rí yìí, méjì nínú wọn jẹ́ èyí tí wọ́n máa ń jù, ọ̀kan tó kù sì jẹ́ èyí tí wọ́n ń rì mọ́lẹ̀, gbogbo wọn ló ti dípẹtà, tí wọn ò sì ṣeé lò mọ́.
English: The “weapons” were actually three rusty, inoperable relics from World War II—two grenades and one landmine.

Yoruba: Ikọ̀ agbábọ́ọ̀lù mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́ta ni wọ́n ti bọwọ́ lù báyìí pé wọn yóò kópa nínú eré ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù Bishop Mike Okonkwo Football Championship 2018, èyí tí yóò wáyé ní pápá ìṣeré National Stadium tìlú Èkó, bẹ̀ẹ̀rẹ̀ lọ́jọ́ karùn-ún oṣù karùn-ún ọdún tí a wà yìí.
English: Sixty-four  clubs have been confirmed for the 2018  Bishop Mike Okonkwo Football Championship scheduled to kick off on May 5 this year at the National Stadium in Lagos.

Yoruba: Orílẹ̀-èdè Germany, Brazil àti Belgium wà lórí òkè téńté tábìlì ọ̀hún ní ìtẹ̀léǹtẹ̀lé, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni Argentina, Croatia àti Iceland wà ní ipò karùn-ún, ipò kejìdínlógún àti ipò kejìlélógún.
English: Germany, Brazil and Belgium were on the top three positions, while Super Eagles world cup foes Argentina, Croatia and Iceland were on fifth, 18th and 22nd positions.

Yoruba: Oyún inú: a kì í kà á kún ọmọọ tilẹ̀.
English: One does not count a pregnancy as a child already delivered.

Yoruba: Lónìí, bó ṣe jẹ́ nígbà náà lọ́hùn-ún, a lè sọ pé wọ́n jẹ́ onígboyà, tó kọ̀ láti lọ́wọ́ sí ìwà ipá tó sì gbé àlàáfíà lárugẹ.
English: Today, as back then, they can be defined as courageous champions of nonviolence and champions of peace.

Yoruba: Ìpè Ohun
English: Voice Calls

Yoruba: Àmì ìrántí tá a gbé síbi pàtàkì nínú ìtàn yìí, ṣe àpọ́nlé ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tí wọ́n ti ní ìgboyà, tí wọ́n jẹ́ adúróṣinṣin tí wọ́n sì ní ìgbàgbọ́ nínú àwọn ìlànà rere táwọn Kristẹni ń tẹ̀ lé kí wọ́n lè máa gbé ìgbé ayé àlàáfíà.
English: This identification plaque, posted at a historically significant site, honors the thousands of Jehovah’s Witnesses who have had courage, loyalty, and faith in the noble Christian principles for the purpose of living in peace.

Yoruba: Òjò àrọ̀ọ̀rọ̀dá tó wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè Tógò ní àsìkò òjò ọdún 2019 fa àkúnya omi ní ibi púpọ̀ láwọn ìgbèríko ìlú Lome, lórílẹ̀-èdè Tógò.
English: Heavy and prolonged rainfall in Togo during the 2019 rainy season has led to significant flooding on the outskirts of Lomé, Togo.

Yoruba: Ní irú àsìkò tí nǹkan nira yìí, àá máa báa lọ láti rántí àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa nínú àwọn àdúrà wa, ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa fún wọn lókun tí wọ́n nílò.​
English: During this time, we continue to keep our brothers in our prayers, confident that Jehovah will keep them strong.

Yoruba: Àwọn ọmọ orílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà lẹ́yìn odi náà ti fọ́n sígboro láti fi àìdùnnú wọn hàn sí ikọ̀ ògbólógbo SARS yìí, tí ó ti ń hu oríṣiríṣi ìwa láabi láti àìmọye ọdún sẹ́yìn.
English: Nigerians in the diaspora have also taken to the streets to show their displeasure with the notorious SARS unit which has, for years, committed crimes with impunity.

Yoruba: A kì í pa asínwín ilé, nítorí ọjọ́ tí tòde yó bàá wá sílé.
English: One does not kill the imbecile within one's home, because of the day when the one from outside might visit one.

Yoruba: Ẹní bá mọ iṣin-ín jẹ a mọ ikú ojúu rẹ̀ẹ́ yọ.
English: Whoever knows how to eat Akee Apple must know how to remove its deadly raphe.

Yoruba: Ní ìpínlẹ̀ Chiapas àti Oaxaca ní Mexico, àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin ọgọ́rùn mẹ́fà àti àádọ́ta lé ní márùn-ún [655] ni kò nílé lórí mọ́ lẹ́yìn tí ìjì líle kan wáyé ní September 7.
English: In the Mexican states of Chiapas and Oaxaca, there were 655 brothers and sisters displaced after the magnitude 8.2 earthquake that occurred on September 7.

Yoruba: Ó dára, lásìkò yìí gbogbo rẹ̀ ti wà lórí PAX ṣá.
English: Well, nowadays everything's on PAX anyway.

Yoruba: À ń bá a lọ láti máa gbàdúrà fún àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa bá a ṣe ń gbé ní àkókò tó le koko yìí, ó dájú pé Jèhófà mọ “wàhálà ọkàn” wọn, á sì bójú tó wọn.—Sáàmù 31:7.
English: We continue to pray for our brothers and sisters during this difficult time, knowing that Jehovah will support them and is aware of their “deep distress.”—Psalm 31:7.

Yoruba: I fẹ́ àwọn ènìyàn ìlú ni yóò jẹ́ òkúta ìpìlẹ̀ fún à ṣẹ ìjọba; a ó máa fi ìfẹ́ yìí hàn nípasẹ̀ ìbò tòótọ́ tí a ó máa dì láti ìgbà dé ìgbà, nínú èyí tí ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan yóò ní ẹ̀tọ́ sí ìbò kan ṣoṣo tí a dì ní ìkọ̀kọ̀ tàbí nípasẹ̀ irú ọ nà ìdìbò mìíràn tí ó bá irú ìdìbò bẹ́ẹ̀ mu.
English: The will of the people shall be the basis of the authority of government; this will shall be expressed in periodic and genuine elections which shall be by universal and equal suffrage and shall be held by secret vote or by equivalent free voting procedures.

Yoruba: Dúró, ó dàbí pé ẹnìkan ti ń jáde bọ̀
English: Wait, it's like someone is coming out

Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Ṣèrìbọmi: 291
English: Total Number Baptized: 291

Yoruba: Olóúnjẹẹ́ tóó bá kú.
English: Someone who has food is worth dying with.

Yoruba: Ìṣòro kan wáyé nígbà àtiyọ̀ ojúlé yìí kúrò
English: There was a problem removing this address

Yoruba: Ẹni tí yó bọ Ògún, yó ra ọjàa tirẹ̀ lọ́tọ̀.
English: The person who will worship Ògun will keep his or her market purchases separate from those of others.

Yoruba: Timur Satdanov, ọ̀kan lára àwọn ará wa tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Gíga Jù Lọ dá láre ní Uzbekistan.
English: Timur Satdanov, one of our brothers exonerated by a Supreme Court victory in Uzbekistan.

Yoruba: Bákan náà, ni ikọ̀ Super Eagles yóò tún kojú England lọ́jọ́ kejí oṣù kẹfà ọdún tí a wà yìí, ní pápá ìṣeré Wembley ṣaájú ìfigagbága ọlọ́rẹ̀ẹ́jọ̀rẹ kẹyìn pẹ̀lú Czech Republic lọ́jọ́ kẹfà sí ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún.
English: World Cup-bound England will be Nigeria’s opponents on June 2  at Wembley ahead of the final warm-up fixture against Czech Republic on June  6.

Yoruba: Látọdún bíi mélòó kan báyìí, April 19, 2019 nìgbà àkọ́kọ́ táwọn ará wa káàkiri orílẹ̀-èdè Uzbekistan ṣe Ìrántí Ikú Kristi tí ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn sì láǹfààní láti wá síbẹ̀.
English: On April 19, 2019, for the first time in recent years, our brothers throughout the entirety of Uzbekistan were able to commemorate the Memorial of Christ’s death publicly.

Yoruba: Kí ni ìyí-dátà-padà-sí-odù-ààbò ìpele-ìṣíkúrò ń ṣe àti ìdí tí o fi lè nílòo rẹ fún?
English: What does transport-layer encryption do and why might you need it?

Yoruba: Má bínú, ìyẹn kò yé mi!
English: Sorry, I don't understand that!

Yoruba: Òkété, báyìí nìwà ẹ; o báFá mulẹ̀ o daFá.
English: So, giant bush rat, such is your character; you made a pact with Ifá and you betrayed Ifá.

Yoruba: Àkòrí tí wọ́n kọ síbi tí wọ́n kó àwọn Bíbélì náà sí ni “The Bible and the Divine Name in Scandinavia” tó túmọ̀ sí Bíbélì àti Orúkọ Àtọ̀runwá Náà ní Scandinavia.
English: The museum theme is “The Bible and the Divine Name in Scandinavia.” The museum brings together a unique collection of rare and significant Bibles in the Danish, Faeroese, Greenlandic, Icelandic, Norwegian, Saami, and Swedish languages.

Yoruba: Àwọn ẹ̀sìn tí wọ́n ń fi owó tì lẹ́yìn láwọn ẹ̀sìn tó ń “fi ìlànà táá jẹ́ káwọn èèyàn máa gbé ní ìrẹ́pọ̀ kọ́ni, tí kì í jẹ́ kí irú ìlànà bẹ́ẹ̀ pa rẹ́” àti ẹ̀sìn“tó ṣeé gbára lé tó sì ń nípa rere lórí àwọn èèyàn.”

English: The Disaster Relief Committees are working with circuit overseers and local elders to care for the physical and spiritual needs of the affected publishers.

English: --- VAR to be used for England, Nigeria friendly- Pinnick

English: The Nigerian government aims to use the NIMC ID to provide a wide range of services, including social safety net, financial inclusion, digital payments, employee pensions, agricultural services, healthcare, education, skill development and employment, law enforcement, land reforms, elections and census.

English: “World Cup 2026: Co-hosting rejected by FIFA after 2002 (also applied in 2010 and 2018).

English: Also, present but not participating was City striker Sergio Aguero, who has been sidelined with a knee injury recently.

English: HELSINKI—On Friday afternoon, August 18, 2017, one of our sisters was killed in Finland in what is being investigated as an act of terrorism targeting women.

English: Preparations began in September 2017 when congregations in Sri Lanka were informed that a special convention would be held the following year.

Yoruba: Lọ́dún 1928, àwọn àlùfáà ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì mú kí ẹ̀ka iléeṣẹ́ ìjọba tó ń rí sí ọ̀rọ̀ owó orí yọ àjọ Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society kúrò lára àwọn àjọ tí ìjọba fọwọ́ sí pé kí wọ́n má san owó orí.
English: In 1928, at the instigation of church leaders, the State Revenue Department retracted the tax exemption status for the Watch Tower Bible and Tract Society.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀rù ogun kì í ba jagun-jagun.

English: Marwa, who was a reserve at the 2014 finals in Brazil, had earlier been removed from the list of match officials due to officiate in Russia.

English: The RWS translation team works in a facility that is just a five-minute walk from the Rwanda branch office in Kigali.

Yoruba: Ayé ò ṣéé bá lérí; wọ́n lè ṣeni léṣe.

Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, aláìsan náà ò ní nílò ìfàjẹ̀sínilára.

Yoruba: Lọ́wọ́lọ́wọ́ báyìí, ìjọ mẹ́sàn-án, àwùjọ mẹ́wàá àti àwọn tó fẹ́ di àwùjọ mẹ́rìnlá (14) tó ń sọ èdè Rómánì ni ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì Czech-Slovak ń bójú tó.
English: Currently, there are 9 Romany congregations, 10 groups, and 14 pregroups in the Czech-Slovak branch territory.

Yoruba: Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Ọ̀yọ́, Seyi Makinde ti sèfilọ́lẹ̀ ọjọ́ ìrántí àwọn ológun ti ọdún 2020 àti àmì ẹ̀yẹ pẹ̀lú ẹ̀bùn owó mílííọ̀nù mẹ́ta náírà.
English: The Governor of Oyo State, Seyi Makinde, has launched the 2020 Armed Forces and Remembrance Day emblem appeal with a N3m donation.

Yoruba: Ní September 6, 2019, a mú Bíbélì Mímọ́ ti Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Tuntun jáde ní èdè Venda, Afrikaans àti Xhosa níbi àpéjọ àgbáyé tá a ṣe nílùú Johannesburg lórílẹ̀-èdè South Africa, ó sì ju mílíọ̀nù mẹ́rìndínlógún (16) èèyàn lọ tó ń sọ àwọn èdè yẹn.
English: On September 6, 2019, at the international convention in Johannesburg, South Africa, the New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures was released in Venda, Afrikaans, and Xhosa, languages spoken by over 16 million people.

Yoruba: Bí a ṣe lè: Lo OTR fún Windows
English: How to: Use OTR for Windows

Yoruba: Akópa nínú ẹgbẹ́ arọ́pò fún àwọn tí-ó-ní-ìpèníjà-ara mìíràn náà sọ ohun tí ó jọ èyí: "àwọn tí wọ́n ń jókòó sórí kẹ̀kẹ́ ayíbìrì á sọ fún-un yín pé 'láti ẹnu ona ni ìrẹ̀wẹ̀sì ti dé bá wa, a sì pẹ̀yìnda', adití á sọ fún-un yín pé ìhùwàsí àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ ìforúkọsílẹ̀ mìíràn kò dára; wọn kì í ní sùúrù tó láti gbọ́ t’èèyàn".
English: Another participant in a focus group for people with disabilities reported similar experiences: “[Wheelchair] riders will tell you ‘from the gate we got discouraged and turned back’, the deaf will tell you that ‘some officials will just give you attitude; they are just not patient enough to understand’”.

Yoruba: Aláǹtakùnún takùn sí ìṣasùn, ṣíbí gbọludé.
English: The spider has woven its web in the sauce-pan; the spoon takes a holiday.

Yoruba: Wèrèé dùn-ún wò, kò ṣéé bí lọ́mọ.
English: An imbecile makes an entertaining spectacle, but one would not want one as one's child.

Yoruba: Mike! Ọlọ́run ṣeun Mike ti dé
English: Mike! Thank God Mike is here

Yoruba: Pẹ̀lẹ́ o
English: Sorry o

English: In his address, the Olota of Ota, Oba Adeyemi Abudukabir who said that Ota is the foremost town among the Awori people, stated that the documentation of the history of Awori’s is apt for the preservation of history.

Yoruba: Àwọn Tó Wá: 46,183
English: Peak Attendance: 46,183

English: Sorry, the media player failed to load. Download This Video

Yoruba: Nínú ọ̀rọ̀ wọn, agbẹnusọ̀ àjọ NFF, Tóyìn Ìbítóyè sọ pé, ààrẹ àjọ NFF, Amaju Pinnick ni ó dari àwọn ìgbìmọ̀ ọ̀hún, tí ó kún fún igbákejì ààrẹ kìnní àjọ NFF, Ṣèyí Akínwùnmí, akọ̀wé àgbà àjọ náà Mohammed Sanusi, olùṣàkóso ikọ̀ Super Eagles, Dayọ̀ Enebi àti akọ́nimọ̀ọ́mú Alloy Agu lọ sí ilé ìwòsàn náà.
English: In a statement, the football house said the NFF president Amaju Pinnick led the delegation consisting of 1st vice-president Seyi Akinwunmi, General Secretary Mohammed Sanusi,  as well as  the national team’s administrator  Dayo Enebi,  goalkeeping coach  Alloy Agu and  spokesman for the team  Toyin Ibitoye.

Yoruba: Ní báyìí, á wù mí báyìí kí n rí i, kí n gbá a mọ́ra, kí n sì jẹ́ kó mọ̀ pé mo nífẹ̀ẹ́ ẹ̀, mo sì wà lẹ́yìn ẹ̀.
English: Now, I would like to hug her and send her my warm love and support.

Yoruba: Ní báyìí, gbogbo ètò ló ti tò sílẹ̀ fún Ààrẹ Muhammadu Buhari, ìgbìmọ̀ àjọ NFF àti àwọn tọ́rọ̀ kàn gbọ̀ngbọ̀n láti gbàlejò ife-ẹ̀yẹ bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé ní Náìjíríà, èyí tí ó jẹ́ ojúṣe àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù lágbàáyé FIFA láti lọ ṣàfihàn ìfe-ẹ̀yẹ ọ̀hún lórílẹ̀-èdè kọ̀ọ̀kan tí yóò máa kópa nínú ìdíje àgbááyé náà Bákan náà, ni àwọn olólùfẹ́ bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá nílùú Abuja àti Èkó yóò ní àǹfààní láti yàwòrán pẹ̀lú ife-ẹ̀yẹ àgbááyé ọ̀hún.
English: All is set for the monumental feat as we look forward to seeing the President of Nigeria accompanied by his executive council lift the FIFA World Cup Trophy. Afterwards fans in Abuja and Lagos will also get an opportunity to see and take pictures with the World Cup trophy.

Yoruba: Ìjọba orílẹ̀-èdè Eritrea ti kọ̀ jálẹ̀ láti tẹ̀ lé ohun tí àwọn àjọ yìí sọ..
English: Eritrea has failed to implement the recommendations issued by these authorities.

Yoruba: tàbí wípé àsè ṣèṣì fi ohun tí ò tọ́ sínúu rẹ̀.

Yoruba: Títí di àkókò yìí, àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa tó lé ní ọgọ́rùn-ún márùn-ún (500) ló ti kó kúrò lágbègbè yẹn tí wọ́n sì lọ síbi tí kò séwu.
English: To date, over 500 brothers have been evacuated to safe locations that included Kingdom Halls and private homes of other Witnesses.

Yoruba: Olúwa ṣeun, ẹ ní òun, a máa lè ṣe àwọn ohun kan
English: Thank God you have her, we'll be able to work some things out

Yoruba: Ọwọ́ atẹ́gùn ò ká gẹdú.

Yoruba: Ẹni àìgbọ́n pa ló pọ̀; ẹni ọgbọ́n pa ò tó nǹkan.
English: People killed by folly are innumerable; people killed by wisdom are few.

Yoruba: Nítorí náà, méjì péré nínú àwọn arákùnrin náà ni wọn ò jù sẹ́wọ̀n ṣáájú ọdún 2013, ìyẹn ọdún tí orílẹ̀-èdè Armenia ṣòfin pé kí iṣẹ́ míì wà, tó jẹ́ iṣẹ́ àṣesìnlú lóòótọ́, tí kì í ṣe iṣẹ́ ológun.
English: Therefore, all but two of the brothers served terms in prison prior to 2013, when Armenia enacted ACS that was truly civilian and stopped imprisoning our brothers for conscientious objection.

Yoruba: “Má fi tìrẹ kọ́ mi lọ́rùn” là ń dá fún apèna àti òwú.
English: “Do not hang your trouble around my neck” is the oracle delivered to the shuttle and the weft thread.

Yoruba: Ìsapá tí wọ́n ṣe yìí mú kí nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún mẹ́rin ó lé mọ́kànléláàádọ́rin (471,000) èèyàn wá síbi Ìrántí Ikú Kristi, èyí sì ju ìlọ́po mẹ́ta iye àwọn akéde tó wà lórílẹ̀-èdè náà.
English: These efforts no doubt contributed to almost 471,000 people attending the Memorial—more than triple the number of publishers.

Yoruba: Emir ti Yashkira, tó wà ní ìjọba ìbílẹ̀ Baruteen ní ìpínlẹ̀ Kwara, ni ààrin gbungbun orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Alhaji Umar Sariki Sabikpasi II, ti ní ohun ti fi tapá –titan sí ìgbésẹ̀ ìjọba àpapọ̀ láti ti ààlà orílẹ̀ èdè yìí pa, ó ní púpọ̀ nínú àwọn ìwà fàyàwọ́ tó ń sẹlẹ̀ lórílẹ̀ èdè yìí ló jẹ́ pé àwọn àjòjì ló ń fàá.̀
English: The Emir of Yashkira, in the Baruteen local government area of Kwara state, North Central Nigeria, Alhaji Umar Sariki Sabikpasi II, has thrown his weight behind border closure, stressing that most of the  smuggling activities taking place in his jurisdiction were being perpetrated by non- indigenes.

Yoruba: Bọ́lá, kílódé tí o ò sọ nǹkankan?

English: Here is our very first patient, out of intensive care, and just watch that chair, all right?

English: (Isaiah 40:8) Over 100 rare Biblical scrolls, leaves, manuscripts, and books are showcased.

English: Chief Kalejaiye explained that he was surprised that the rest of the land was occupied by hoodlums with construction of shanties on the land.

English: A statement by FIFA said the recent flurry of pre-World Cup friendlies left its mark on the latest rankings.

English: "Andrzej Oniszczuk, a Polish citizen and one of our dear brothers, has been in pretrial detention in Russia since security forces arrested him on October 9, 2018.

English: Russia Violated International Law in Detaining 18 Jehovah’s Witnesses, UN Expert Panel Says

English: One contact, a woman who had not been receptive when Witnesses preached to her in the past, thanked the couple and commended their initiative.

English: He is being accused of “extremist” activity simply for holding small Christian meetings in his home, the prosecution has asked the court to sentence Brother Shpakovskiy to seven and a half years in prison.

Yoruba: Pẹ̀lú gbogbo ìwọ̀nyí, ìwọ̀nyí ni ìbéèrè tí o lè ṣe kí o tó gba ẹ̀dà irinṣẹ́ sílẹ̀, rà á, tàbí lò ó.
English: Given all that, here are some questions you can ask about a tool before downloading, purchasing, or using it.

Yoruba: Àá máa bá a lọ láti wà lójúfò, àá sì máa ṣọ́ra, síbẹ̀ a ò ní jẹ́ kí ìbẹ̀rù bò wá mọ́lẹ̀, àá sì máa fìtara wàásù nìṣó.”—Oníwàásù 9:11; Róòmù 15:13; Fílípì 4:6, 7.
English: We will also continue to take practical steps and not allow undue anxiety to overtake us while moving forward with our witnessing efforts.”—Ecclesiastes 9:11; Romans 15:13; Philippians 4:6, 7.

Yoruba: ADHD jẹ́ àìsàn àìpé ọpọlọ
English: ADHD is a neuro developmental order

Yoruba: Kì í ṣe ojúu kọ̀lọ̀kọ̀lọ̀ ladìẹ́ ti ń jẹ̀.

Yoruba: Nígbà tí wọ́n bá ń dúkokò mọ́ àwọn aṣíkiri pẹ̀lú ìkójọpọ̀, ìtì-mọ́lé àti ìdápadà-sílé, àwọn òṣìṣẹ wọn mọ̀ pé wọ́n lè bú wọn, pé wọ́n lè sọ fún wọn pé tí wọ́n bá jà padà, wọ́n lè fàwón fún ICE.
English: When immigrants are threatened with roundups, detention and deportations, their employers know that they can be abused, that they can be told that if they fight back, they'll be turned over to ICE.

English: Representatives of the Thailand Embassy watch as a brother translates our publications into Peruvian Sign Language.

Yoruba: Ó fọwọ́ ya onírúuru àwòrán, ó ya fọ́tò àwọn àwòrán náà, ó sì fi í ránṣẹ́ sáwọn ojúlùmọ̀ ẹ̀ tó jẹ́ adití.
English: She then took a photograph of it and sent it via text message to all of her contacts who are deaf.

Yoruba: Àgbókan là ń rọ́ Ifá adití.
English: It is with full voice volume that one recites divination verses for the deaf.

English: Work in order that you might have; intentions do not become possessions; no one makes money by magic.

Yoruba: Ẹni tí ó bá máa jẹ́ Ọ̀ṣákálà a jẹ́ Ọṣákálá; ẹni tó bá máa jẹ́ Òṣokolo a jẹ́ Òṣokolo; èwo ni Ọ̀ṣákálá-ṣokolo?
English: Whoever wants to be known as Ọ̀ṣákálá should be known as Ọ̀ṣákálá; whoever wants to be known as Òṣokolo should be known as Òṣokolo; what is the meaning of Ọ̀ṣákálá-ṣokolo?

Yoruba: Àsẹ̀yìnwá àsẹ̀yìnbọ̀, ó pàdánù káàdì SIM rẹ̀, tí ó wá ku bí ìjọba yóò ṣe kàn sí i láti jẹ́ kí ó mọ bí káàdìi rẹ̀ bá ti wà nílẹ̀ fún gbígbà.
English: Eventually, he lost his SIM card, leaving the government no way to let him know his card is ready.

Yoruba: Bótilẹ̀jẹ́pé ẹ̀rọ-alátagbà ni ìṣètò tìrẹ, o lè rí àwòṣe.

Yoruba: Kó tó dìgbà tí wọ́n máa gbọ́ ẹjọ́ ẹ̀, wọ́n ò fún un lómìnira láti jáde bó ṣe fẹ́.
English: While awaiting trial, he has been required to comply with restrictions on his activities.

Yoruba: Eléré sísá mé̩rìndínló̩gbò̩n nípìnínlè̩ Kwara ti kó lọ sípàgó̩ fúngbàáradì de ìdíje oríṣìí eré ìdárayá mé̩wàá tí yóò wáyé ní eré àwọn ò̩dó̩ ilè̩ Adúláwò̩ ní Algiers ni orílè̩ èdè Algeria láìpé̩.
English: Twenty six Athletes from Kwara State have been invited to camp in ten different sports ahead of the preparations for the Africa Youth Games, holding in Algiers, Algeria, later in the year.

Yoruba: Lè jẹ́ èyíkéyìí irúfẹ́ olùṣàmúlò
English: Can be any type of user

English: It is up to each individual whether to contribute or not.”

English: Valid only for Coach and Admin user types

Yoruba: Àwọn olùwọ́de kó ara wọn jọ sí agbègbè kan ní àdúgbò Khartoum, bí wọ́n ṣe ńfura pé olórí àwọn adìtẹ̀ gba ìjọba ọ̀hún leè súnmọ́ ọ̀gbẹ́ni Bashir pẹ́kípẹ́kí.

Yoruba: Lẹ́yìn tí a ti rí ipò àdánidá tí àjọ ẹgbẹ́ àwùjọ wà ní orílẹ̀-èdèe Nàìjíríà, ó máa dára láti rí àwọn iléeṣẹ́ ńláńlá nílẹ̀ yìí àti ní ilẹ̀ òkèèrè, pẹ̀lú àwọn alágbàwí àti àwọn olùdókoòwò tí wọ́n máa náwó sí ìgbéǹde onírúurú àwọn àjọ ẹgbẹ́ àwùjọ tí kì í ṣe ti ìjọba nínú ìlú yìí.
English: Given the overburdened state of civil society in Nigeria, it would be good to see regional and international organisations, advocates and funders invest resources into a wide range of civil society organisations in the country.

Yoruba: Kò ní yà yín lẹ́nu pé ilé kékeré tí wọ́n kọ́ nígbà yẹn ni ilé ìjọsìn àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tá a kọ́kọ́ pè ní “Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba.” Àtìgbà yẹn làwa èèyàn Jèhófà ti ń pe àwọn ibi tá a máa ń kóra jọ sí láti jọ́sìn ní Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba, ìyẹn sì ti lé lọ́gọ́rin (80) ọdún báyìí.
English: This little building would carry the distinction of being the first in the world to be named “Kingdom Hall.” It would also serve as an anchor for tremendous growth over the next eight decades.

Yoruba: "Méjì lára àwọn arákùnrin tí wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n jáde nílé rèé pẹ̀lú àwọn agbẹjọ́rò wọn. Láti ọwọ́ òsì sí ọ̀tún: agbẹjọ́rò Vitaly Svintsov, Vladimir Kochnev, Aleksandr Suvorov àti agbẹjọ́rò Egiazar Chernikov.
English: "Two of the brothers recently placed under house arrest with their attorneys. Pictured from left to right: attorney Vitaly Svintsov, Vladimir Kochnev, Aleksandr Suvorov, and attorney Egiazar Chernikov.

Yoruba: Láti July 1, ẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn tí wọ́n ti fi kan àwọn arákùnrin àtàwọn arábìnrin wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà ti tó igba ó lé mẹ́tàdínlógún (217).
English: The growing list of criminal cases against our brothers and sisters in Russia has reached 217 as of July 1.

Yoruba: Àmọ́, ó kéré tán, ilé àwọn ìdílé mọ́kàndínlógún (19) ni omíyalé àti àbàtà náà bà jẹ́.
English: However, the homes of at least 19 families were damaged by mudslides or flooding.

Yoruba: Nígba tí Ọ̀mọ̀wé Gabriele Hammermann, tó jẹ́ alábòójútó Ibi Ìrántí Tó Wà ní Àgọ́ Ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ Ìlú Dachau ń bá àwọn èèyàn sọ̀rọ̀, ó ṣàlàyé pé: “Wọ́n ṣe inúnibíni sí Àwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì [bí wọ́n ṣe ń pe Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà nígbà yẹn] torí pé ohun tí wọ́n gbà gbọ́ ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n di ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ èyíkéyìí nínú ètò òṣèlú ìjọba Nazi, kò jẹ́ kí wọ́n máa kan sáárá sí Hitler tàbí kí wọ́n wọṣẹ́ ológun.” Ó fi kún un pé: “Àwọn tó wà lẹ́wọ̀n pẹ̀lú Àwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì bọ̀wọ̀ fún wọn torí ìwà ọmọlúwàbí wọn, wọ́n kì í sì í yé sọ̀rọ̀ nípa bí wọ́n ṣe jẹ́ adúróṣinṣin tó sì máa ń yá wọn lára láti ṣèrànlọ́wọ́.” Arákùnrin Wolfram Slupina, tó jẹ́ agbẹnusọ fún àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní orílẹ̀-èdè Jámánì, sọ pé ọ̀pọ̀ lára àwọn tó wá síbi ayẹyẹ náà ni kò mọ Arákùnrin Eckert, kódà ó sọ pé: “A ò ní fọ́tò Max Eckert lọ́wọ́.” Ó wá fi kún ọ̀rọ̀ rẹ̀ pé, àmì ìrántí náà mú kó ṣeé ṣe láti “mọ bí [Arákùnrin Eckert] ṣe jẹ́ adúróṣinṣin tó àti bó ṣe pinnu láti má ṣe fi ìgbàgbọ́ rẹ̀ báni dọ́rẹ̀ẹ́​—àní títí dójú ikú.” Kò sí iyèméjì pé Jèhófà ò gbàgbé ìgbàgbọ́ àti ìwà títọ́ Max Eckert àti tàwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà míì tó kú nítorí ìgbàgbọ́ wọn.​—Hébérù 6:10.
English: During her presentation at the ceremony, Dr. Gabriele Hammermann, director of the Dachau Concentration Camp Memorial Site, explained: “The Bible Students [as Jehovah’s Witnesses were then known] were persecuted because their beliefs did not allow them to become members of any Nazi organizations, give the Hitler salute, or participate in military service.” She further stated: “Former fellow prisoners [described] the attitude of the Bible Students with great respect and especially [emphasized] their steadfastness and willingness to help.” Brother Wolfram Slupina, a spokesman for Jehovah’s Witnesses in Germany, acknowledged that Brother Eckert was an obscure figure to many attendees of the ceremony, stating: “We do not even have a picture of Max Eckert.” But he added, the plaque succeeds in “acknowledging the steadfastness [Brother Eckert] showed and his religious conviction without compromise—even to death.” Without question, Jehovah remembers the faith and integrity of Max Eckert, as well as all other Jehovah’s Witnesses who have died for their faith.—Hebrews 6:10.

At the end of the highly interactive forum, the ship owners expressed their willingness to partner with NIMASA to realise it’s set objectives to boost the intergrity of indigenous ships in the international community.

Yoruba: Ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ló ní ẹ̀tọ́ pé kí a kà á sí gẹ́gẹ́ bí ènìyàn lábẹ́ òfin ní ibi gbogbo.
English: Everyone has the right to recognition everywhere as a person before the law.

English: Five Cameroonian athletes competing at the Commonwealth Games in Australia have gone missing.

Yoruba: Ó ti ṣètò bí wọ́n ṣe máa ta àtagbà àsọyé náà ní ọgbà ẹ̀wọ̀n méjèèjì.
English: He was already arranging to broadcast the talk in both facilities.

Yoruba: Àwọn dókítà ṣèbẹ̀wò síbi ìpàtẹ wa níbi àpérò SIAARTI tí wọ́n ṣe ni erékùṣù Palermo Ọ̀pọ̀ dókítà ló ń dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ètò wa torí ìsọfúnni tá a pèsè kárí ayé nípa onírúurú ìtọ́jú ìṣègùn àti iṣẹ́ abẹ láìfa ẹ̀jẹ̀ síni lára.
English: Medical professionals visit our booth at the SIAARTI conference in Palermo Many doctors have expressed appreciation for the worldwide network that our organization has established to provide information about medical and surgical treatment strategies to avoid blood transfusion.

Yoruba: Àǹfààní ńlá ló jẹ́ fún wa pé a kópa nínú ètò ayẹyẹ ńlá yìí, a sì fẹ́ láti dúpẹ́ gan-an lọ́wọ́ Ìgbìmọ̀ Àpéjọ yín àti àwọn tó yọ̀ǹda ara wọn fún ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ wọn.
English: It has been a great event to be a part of, and we would like to give a huge thanks for the cooperation from your Convention Committee and all the volunteers.

Yoruba: Irúfé ìdíje ńlá yìí tí o wáyé kẹ́yìn nílẹ̀ Áfíríkà, wáyé lórílẹ̀-èdè South Africa lọ́dún 2010, èyí tí Blatter kòsí kábàámọ̀ pé ilẹ̀-Áfíríkà ṣagbátẹrù rẹ̀.
English: The only tournament staged in Africa so far was the 2010 finals in South Africa, something Blatter is immensely proud of.

Yoruba: Bí àjànàkú ò bá gbẹ́kẹ̀lé fùrọ̀, kì í mi òdù àgbọn.

Yoruba: A ń rí ẹ̀rí tó fi hàn pé Jèhófà ń bù kún àwọn ará wa bí wọ́n ṣe gbẹ́kẹ̀ lé e, ìyẹn sì túbọ̀ ń fún wa níṣìírí.—Sáàmù 56:1-5, 9."
English: Yet, our brothers remain undeterred. We are encouraged by the evidence that Jehovah is blessing our brothers’ full confidence in him.—Psalm 56:1-5, 9."

Yoruba: Pà-pà lójú lẹ́ẹ̀kínní, pà-pà lójú lẹ́ẹ̀kejì; bójú náà ò bá fọ́, bàì-bàì ní ń dà.
English: A blow to the eye the first time, and a blow to the eye a second time; if the eye does not go blind it will only see dimly.

English: He said, in part: “If you look at the current situation from an unbeliever’s viewpoint, you might despair. . . .

Yoruba: Bákan náà, ilé mẹ́rìnlélọ́gọ́sàn-án (184) àwọn ará wa ni wọ́n ti parí àtúnṣe rẹ̀ tàbí tí wọ́n ti tún ṣe díẹ̀ kó lè ṣeé gbé, àwọn ilé mọ́kànlá míì sì wà tí wọ́n ṣètò láti tún ṣe lọ́dún yìí.
English: Also, 184 homes of Witnesses have been repaired or stabilized, and another 11 homes are scheduled to be repaired this year.

Yoruba: Ó máa wù mí pé ká má ṣe fi ẹ̀tọ́ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà dù wọ́n ní orílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà náà, kò sì ní yẹ kí ilé ẹjọ́ yìí fi ẹ̀tọ́ tí mo ní láti gba Ọlọ́run gbọ́ dù mí.
English: I would very much like the rights of believers to be respected in Russia as well and, in this instance, my rights as a believer.

Yoruba: Abẹ ní ń bẹ orí; oníṣẹ́ àtẹ́lẹsẹ̀ ní ń bẹ ọ̀nà; bèbè ìdí ní ń bẹ kíjìpá; bí a dáwọ́ọ bíbẹni, a tán nínú ẹni.
English: The razor begs the scalp; the wayfarer's soles beg the path; waist beads beg the home-woven cloth; when the begging is done, one lets matters drop.

Yoruba: Alákatam̀pòó ṣe bí ọ̀bọ ò gbọ́n; ọ̀bọ́ gbọ́n; tinú ọ̀bọ lọ̀bọ́ ń ṣe.
English: The person with the cross-bow thinks that the monkey is not clever; the monkey is clever, but it is following its own strategy.

English: Let the person one advises heed one; the heedless person places himself at risk.

English: He then spent eight months in pretrial detention before being moved to house arrest at the end of February 2019.

English: Additionally, it will assist them in preaching to the over 9,000,000 individuals who speak the language, approximately 80 percent of Zimbabwe’s population.

Yoruba: Ilé-iṣẹ́ ìwé ìròyìn The SUN fi àmì-ẹ̀yẹ Sports Personality of the Year dá ààrẹ àjọ NFF, Amaju Melvin Pinnick lọ́lá, fún ìgbàkejì lọ́dún méjì sẹ́yìn, lọ́jọ́ Àìkú (Sunday). Ayẹyẹ ìgbàmì ẹ̀yẹ ọ̀hún ló wáyé nílé ìtura Eko Hotels and Suites, Victoria Island, nílùú Èkó. Níbití ilé-iṣẹ́ ìwé ìròyìn náà ti ń ṣayẹyẹ ọdún márùndínlógún tí wọ́n ṣàgbékẹ̀lé rẹ̀. Nínú ìgbàmì-ẹ̀yẹ ọ̀hún, àwọn èèyàn jàǹkàn-jàǹkàn mìíràn tí wọ́n tún fi àmì-ẹ̀yẹ dá lọ́lá ni, ààrẹ àgbà ilé ìgbìmọ̀ aṣóju-sòfin, Dókítà Bùkọ́lá Sàràkí, pẹ̀lú àmì-ẹ̀yẹ olóṣèlú to tayọ jùlọ (Outstanding Politican of the Year), Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Èkó, ọ̀gbẹ́ni Akinwunmi Ambode gba àmì-ẹyẹ (Man of the Year), Gómìnà ìpínlẹ̀ Rivers, Nyesom Wike (Governor of the Year), Emir ìpínlẹ̀ Kano, Alhaji Muhammad Sanusi (Courage in Leadership Award), adarí àgbà àjọ NDDC, Nsima Ekere (Public Service Award), adarí àgbà ilé ìfowópamọ́ Zenith, Peter Amangbo (Banker of the Year),  Dókítà Emeka Okwuosa (Investor of the Year); Dókítà Samuel Adédoyin (Lifetime Achievement Award); adarí àgbà ilé ìfowópamọ́ àgbà CBN, Godwin Emefiele (Public Service Award), bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni aṣòfin Osita Izunaso àti Dókìtà gba àmì-ẹ̀yẹ ìsọmọnìyàn (Humanitarian Service Award).
English: For the second time in two years, The SUN newspapers on Saturday presented the Sports Personality of the Year gong to President of Nigeria Football Federation, Mr. Amaju Melvin Pinnick.  At a well-attended Awards ceremony at the Eko Hotels and Suites, Victoria Island, Lagos that also marked 15 years of the top media house’s existence, Pinnick was honoured alongside other prominent and dedicated Nigerians like Senate President Bukola Saraki (Outstanding Politican of the Year); Governor Akinwunmi Ambode of Lagos State (Man of the Year); Governor Nyesom Wike of Rivers State (Governor of the Year); Emir of Kano, Alhaji Muhammad Sanusi (Courage in Leadership Award); NDDC Managing Director Nsima Ekere (Public Service Award); Zenith Bank’s Group Managing Director Peter Amangbo (Banker of the Year); Dr. Emeka Okwuosa (Investor of the Year); Dr. Samuel Adedoyin (Lifetime Achievement Award); Central Bank Managing Director Godwin Emefiele (Public Service Award) and; the pair of Senator Osita Izunaso and Dr. Joe Okei-Odumakin (Humanitarian Service Award).

English: “Many of my colleagues seem really scared, like I’ve never seen before,” Brother Mudaheranwa says.

English: Zagat editor Molly Moker heads to 44 Farms in Cameron, Texas, for a first-hand look at some of the work that goes into raising the ranch's black Angus beef.

Yoruba: Alága yìí tó fi èhónú rẹ̀ hàn bí àwọn Olùdìbò ṣe kọ̀ láti jáde kópa nínú eto ìdìbò ọ̀hún.
English: The Chairman however expressed disappointment over the low turn-out of voters during the election.

Yoruba: Igbákejì ààrẹ orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n Yemí Òsínbàjò ní oriĺẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà jẹ oriĺẹ̀ èdè tó ní ẹ̀yà, àsà àti èdè orísirísi, nítorí ipa tí àwọn akínkanjú kan tó fi ara wọn se ìrúbọ nígbà kan sẹ́yìn àti níbàyìí ti kó.
English: The Vice President of Nigeria, Professor Yemi Osinbajo has stated that the diverse people of Nigeria are a nation today because of the sacrifices of our heroes both past and present.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún yóò wáyé lọ́jọ́ kejì oṣù kẹfà ọdún tí a wà yìí, fún ìgbáradì ní kíkún ṣaájú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbáyé tó ń bọ̀ lọ́nà.
English: The football match will take place on June 2 in a warm-up game ahead of the World Cup in Russia.

English: The woman quickly wrote back asking questions.

Yoruba: Ó yá...
English: So let's go..

Yoruba: Atúmọ̀ èdè míì tóun náà ṣe nínú iṣẹ́ ìtumọ̀ náà sọ pé: “Tá a bá fi Bíbélì yìí kọ́ àwọn èèyàn lẹ́kọ̀ọ́, àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì á lóye àwọn koko pàtàkì lọ́nà tó rọrùn ju ti tẹ́lẹ̀ lọ, á sì wọ̀ wọ́n lọ́kàn, èyí á sì jẹ́ kí wọ́n ní ìbátan tímọ́tímọ́ pẹ̀lú Jèhófà.” Ó dá wa lójú pé Ìwé Mímọ́ Kristian Lédè Griki ní Ìtumọ̀ Ayé Titun yìí á ran àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa tó ń sọ èdè Lao lọ́wọ́ láti kí wọ́n lè “kúnjú ìwọ̀n dáadáa, kí wọ́n sì gbára dì pátápátá fún gbogbo iṣẹ́ rere.”​—2 Tímótì 3:​16, 17.
English: Another translator who assisted with the project states: “When we use this translation in our teaching, Bible students will understand important points much more easily than before, and it will reach their heart, helping them to cultivate love for Jehovah as a person.” We are confident the New World Translation of the Christian Greek Scriptures will help the Laotian-speaking brothers and sisters continue to be “fully competent, completely equipped for every good work.”—2 Timothy 3:16, 17.

Yoruba: Abala kejìdínlọ́gbọ̀n
English: Article 28

English: And this is one of the reasons why, over the years, I have always tried to make adjustments in order to please them.

Yoruba: Ogun kì í jà kó wọlé Asẹ́yín.

English: President Buhari met the U.S Treasury Secretary, Steven Mnuchin in Riyadh and they had positive discussions on investments in Nigeria.

English: The churches later openly admitted their goal was to negatively impact the Bible Students’ preaching work.

Yoruba: Ọjọ́ kejìdínlọ́gbọ̀n oṣù June, ọdún 2018 ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ nínú ìtàn ilẹ̀ South Korea tí Ilé Ẹjọ́ Tó Ń Rí Sí Ẹ̀tọ́ Ọmọnìyàn máa sọ pé apá kan lára Ìlànà Iṣẹ́ Ológun Ilẹ̀ Korea, ìyẹn “Korea’s Military Service Act (MSA)” kò bófin mu, torí pé kò gba àwọn tí ẹ̀rí ọkàn wọn ò jẹ́ kí wọ́n ṣiṣẹ́ ológún láyè láti ṣe iṣẹ́ míì.
English: On June 28, 2018, for the first time in South Korea’s history, the Constitutional Court declared a section of Korea’s Military Service Act (MSA) unconstitutional, as it does not provide alternative service for conscientious objectors.

English: I bought it for you as your husband

English: Whereas wealthier people can afford to pay for for registration officers to come to them or pay to, as interviewees said, "jump the queue" even though these bribes are supposedly not allowed, people with limited resources stand in registration centre queues for anywhere from hours to days.

Yoruba: Kí á lé akátá jìnnà ká tó bá adìẹ wí.

English: “Many church members concluded that the church leaders endorsed the killing,” said Professor Longman.

Yoruba: A kì í múlé móko kọ́kan má yẹ̀.

Yoruba: Ṣàkíyèsí bí o bá ní ìfàsẹ́yìn owó, ìfàsẹ́yìn ẹ̀rọ, tàbí ìfàsẹ́yìn ìkẹ́gbẹ́.
English: Note if you have any financial constraints, technical constraints, or social constraints.

Yoruba: Ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sáwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti wá di ẹ̀rí tí kò lẹ́gbẹ́ pé, wọn ò fi ìgbàgbọ́ wọn nínú Ọlọ́run báni dọ́rẹ̀ẹ́, torí náà, wọ́n yẹ lẹ́ni àpọ́nlé, wọ́n sì níyì ju gbogbo àwọn míì tí ìjọba ṣenúnibíni sí lọ.

English: An article describing enclosure, which is an issue that presents itself in a commons

Yoruba: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọdọọdún la túbọ̀ ń rí ẹ̀rí tó fi hàn pé, ó léwu gan-an tá a bá fa ògidì sẹ́ẹ̀lì pupa inú ẹ̀jẹ̀ tàbí èyíkéyìí lára èròjà ẹ̀jẹ̀ síni lára.
English: However, the evidence related to the possible harmful effects connected to the transfusions of both concentrated red blood cells and the other blood components has increased each year.

English: The Working Group’s call to action does not guarantee that our brothers and sisters in Russia will be exonerated, but there is hope that it may improve the situation.

Yoruba: Inú wa dùn pé ìyípadà yìí máa mú kí àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà túbọ̀ lẹ́tọ̀ọ́ lórílẹ̀-èdè Kyrgyzstan láti máa pé jọ fún ìjọsìn ká sì máa báwọn èèyàn sọ̀rọ̀ nípa Bíbélì láìsí wàhálà.—1 Tímótì 2:1-4."
English: We rejoice that this positive development will help further establish the right for Witnesses in Kyrgyzstan to meet freely for worship and peacefully share the Bible’s message with others.—1 Timothy 2:1-4."

Yoruba: Àkànṣe lọfà ìmàdò; jagan oró ò ran èse.

English: Two days after the sentencing of Brother Christensen, four well-known Russian human rights experts organized a press conference in Moscow.

Yoruba: Mi ò kí ń ṣe apààyàn, mi ò pa ẹnikẹ́ni
English: I'm not a murderer, I didn't kill anyone

English: Tajik Authorities Unjustly Sentence 68-Year-Old Brother Shamil Khakimov to Seven and a Half Years in Prison

Yoruba: Mínísítà fún ètò ìrìnnà lórílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà, Rotimi Amaechi ni ó sọ̀rọ̀ yìí lásìkò tó ń se ìfilọ́lẹ̀ ètò ọkọ̀ ojú irin náà.
English: Minister of Transportation, Rotimi Amaechi who flagged off the train service.

Yoruba: Ní July 1948, àwa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ṣe àpéjọ kan ní ìlú Kassel lórílẹ̀-èdè Jámánì. Àpéjọ yìí ni àpéjọ térò tíì pọ̀ jù táwa Ẹlẹ́rìí ṣe nílẹ̀ Yúróòpù lẹ́yìn tí Ogun Àgbáyé Kejì jà.
English: In July 1948, in the German city of Kassel, Jehovah’s Witnesses held what was the largest gathering of Witnesses in Europe in the aftermath of World War II.

Yoruba: Australia dipò kẹrin mú nínú ipò àtẹ àjọ FIBA tí ó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ jáde, Turkey wà ní ipò keje, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni Argentina dipò karùndínlógún mú lágbàáyé.
English: Australia are ranked fourth in the latest FIBA rankings while Turkey are seventh and Argentina are 15th in the world.

Yoruba: Castro tún kópa fún orílẹ̀-èdè rè, Spain nínú ìdíje bọ́ọ̀lù àgbááyé lọ́dún 1978 àti 1982, bákan náà ló tún kópa nínú ìdíje European Championship lọ́dún 1980. Ó gbá àmì-ayò mẹ́jọ wọlé nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ márùnlélọ́gbọ̀n tí ó gbá fún orílẹ̀-èdè Spain.
English: An international with Spain, Castro played at the World Cup in 1978 and 1982, as well as the European Championship in 1980. He scored eight goals in 35 appearances for the national side.

Yoruba: Ó so̩yí ní pápákọ̀ òfurufú Nnamdi Azikiwe nílùú Àbújá, bí ó s̩e ti Germany dé.
English: He said this at the Nnamdi Azikiwe International airport, Abuja as he arrived from Germany.

Yoruba: "Ní September 9, 2019 ìjì líle tó ń jẹ́ Faxai jà nítòsí Tokyo, lórílẹ̀-èdè Japan.
English: "On September 9, 2019, powerful Typhoon Faxai made landfall near Tokyo, Japan.

Yoruba: Ìfòfindè títí lái yìí jẹ́ ṣíṣe láti ọwọ́ ìgbìmọ̀ tí ó ń ṣèdájọ́ ìwà-ìbàjẹ́ àjọ CAF, èyí tí ó tún fi òfin de àwọn adarí ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ bọ́ọ̀lù mẹ́wàá mìíràn fún ọdún méjì sí ọdún mẹ́wàá fún irúfẹ́ ẹ̀sùn kan náà.
English: The life ban was handed out by CAF’s disciplinary board, which also banned 10 other referees for between two years and 10 years for similar offences.

Yoruba: A mọ̀ pé Jèhófà ń rí ìyà tó ń jẹ wọ́n, ó sì máa fún wọn lókun tá á jẹ́ kí wọ́n lè fara da àkókò wàhálà yìí.​
English: We know that Jehovah sees their difficulty and will continue to give them strength to cope with this time of distress.

Yoruba: Yàtọ̀ síyẹn, àwọn alàgbà náà ń sọ ohun táwọn èèyàn lè ṣe láti dáàbò bo ara wọn tí àkúnya omi bá tún ṣẹlẹ̀.
English: Additionally, the elders have been distributing information outlining safety precautions in the event of further flooding.

Yoruba: Mi ò tiẹ̀ rí nǹkan tí mò ń wá níbẹ̀.
English: I can't even find what I'm looking for there.

Yoruba: Ipò tí ẹ wà
English: Your condition

Yoruba: Nígbà tí atúmọ̀ èdè kan ń sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ohun tó ṣàrà ọ̀tọ̀ nínú Bíbélì náà, ó sọ pé: “Inú wa dùn gan-an pé a lè ka Bíbélì látòkèdélẹ̀ ní èdè tó wọni lọ́kàn!” Atúmọ̀ èdè míì sọ pé: “Ní pàtàkì jùlọ, [Bíbélì tá a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ mú jáde yìí] máa jẹ́ ká lè sún mọ́ Jèhófà torí pé léraléra ló lo orúkọ Ọlọ́run.”
English: Commenting on the unique features of the Bibles, one translator excitedly said: “We are all going to start our Bible reading afresh with the language that touches our hearts!” Another translator noted: “Most importantly, [the newly released Bible] will help us to draw closer to Jehovah because it uses God’s name repeatedly.”

Yoruba: Ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Cross River ti rọ ìjọba àpapọ̀ láti sàtìlẹyìn fún ojú ọ̀nà márosẹ̀ àti ìbùdó omi òkun tó wà ní Bakasi tí ìpínlẹ̀ náà ti dawọ́lé.
English: The Cross River State government has appealed to Nigerian government for assistance towards completing the super high way and Bakasi Deep Sea Port, which the State is currently constructing.

Yoruba: Inú wa dùn láti gbọ́ nípa ìgbòkègbodò iṣẹ́ ìwàásù tó ń gbòòrò sí i yìí. Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà á máa bá a lọ láti bù kún àwọn arákùnrin àti arábìnrin wa ní Peru, bí wọ́n ṣe ń tẹ̀ síwájú láti wàásù fún àwọn èèyàn níbi gbogbo tí a ti lè rí wọn.​
English: We are confident that Jehovah will continue to bless the work of our brothers and sisters in Peru as they continue to preach wherever people can be found.

Yoruba: Òjò Alátẹ́gùn Rọ́ Lu Orílẹ̀-Èdè Philippines

English: Thousands of Jehovah’s Witnesses from seven countries joined their brothers and sisters in Sri Lanka for a special convention, the first ever in Sri Lanka.

Yoruba: Nígbà tó di February 1932, ìjọba ìpínlẹ̀ Upper Bavaria fọwọ́ sí ìfòfindè náà, àwọn ará wa sì pe ẹjọ́ kòtẹ́milọ́rùn. Àmọ́ nígbà tó di March ọdún yẹn, Ilé Iṣẹ́ Tó Ń Bójú Tó Ọ̀rọ̀ Abẹ́lé ní ìpínlẹ̀ Bavaria fọwọ́ rọ́ ẹjọ́ àwọn Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì náà dà nù, wọ́n ní “kòlẹ́sẹ̀ nílẹ̀.”
English: In February 1932, the government of Upper Bavaria upheld this ban, and in March of that year, the Bavarian Ministry of the Interior rejected the Bible Students’ appeal considering it “without foundation.”

Yoruba: Bẹ́ẹ̀ gẹ́lẹ́ la ṣe ṣe ìṣelọ́jọ̀ àwọn ilé-ìtajà náà.

English: While giving further details on the self-quarantine strategy, the Commissioner explained that persons observing self-quarantine must stay as home during the whole duration and must avoid workplace, minimize contact with visitors, refrain from attending public or social function and must not ride or fly in any mode of public transportation

English: Construction of New Branch Office in Cameroon Underway

English: With flooding now becoming the major concern, volunteers from local congregations and others invited from elsewhere are coming to assist and will be working under the direction of the DRC.

English: Now, I can't speak for everyone, but this is especially true for young immigrant professionals like me.

English: In May 2016, you met a group of men who claimed to be interested in the beliefs of Jehovah’s Witnesses.

English: In conclusion, I hope that this will work for over 40 percent of men with prayers, patience and overlooking things.

English: Some resources selected

English: “Stew is the breast milk of adults” is what killed the calabash repairer of Ògòdò town.

Yoruba: Atamátàsé ikọ̀ ọ̀hún Effiong Ndifereke ló gbá àmì-ayò kínní wọlé níṣẹ̀ẹ́jú mọ́kàndínlọ́gbọ̀n sáà àkọ́kọ́ ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọ̀hún, béẹ̀ sì ni Sam Obi gbá àmì-ayò kejì wọlé kí sáà àkọ́kọ́ ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà ó tó wá sí ìparí.
English: Abia Warriors’ forward Effiong Ndifereke helped to turn the team’s fortunes around with a brace in the ninth and 29th minutes. Sam Obi scored Abia Warriors’ second goal at the 16th minute during a goal-mouth scramble.

Yoruba: Bí a kò bá torí iṣu jẹ epo, à torí epo jẹṣu.
English: If one does not eat oil because of yams, one will eat yams because of oil.

Yoruba: Fi ìdánwò kúkúrú sílẹ̀
English: Submit quiz

Yoruba: Wọ́n ní,; “Àwòko, o bú ọba.” Ó ní ìgbà wo lòún ráàye bú ọba, kóun tó kọ igba lówùúrọ̀, igba lọ́sàn-án, igba lálẹ́, kóun tó fi àyìndà-yindà lù ú?
English: They said, “Mocking bird, you are accused of insulting the king.” It asked when would it have time to insult the king, seeing that it must sing two hundred songs in the morning, two hundred in the afternoon, and two hundred at night, mixing it all up with some frolicsome notes?

English: We live in a world right now where a dictator can be praised for executing his uncle, for killing his half brother, killing thousands of North Koreans.

English: Additionally, 205 Witness families from Bunia supplied money, food, and housing to their displaced brothers, despite being of limited means.

English: “Being so isolated has been particularly stressful for us in Iqaluit as we cope with financial setbacks and uncertainties of this pandemic,” states Sister Laura McGregor.

English: Today that approach is used by millions of creators around the globe.

English: President Muhammadu Buhari has authorised the deployment of air power to counter the menace of bandits operating in the forest area bordering Kaduna, Niger and Zamfara states, The President has received assurances that with the harmattan dust gradually easing its hold on the skies, fighter aircraft would this week join the efforts to provide effective air attacks against bandits, kidnappers and cattle rustlers that have been attacking remote communities around Dogon Gona forest in Niger State.

Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, ìtọ́jú náà á túbọ̀ gbéṣẹ́.”​—⁠Luca Ansaloni, tó jẹ́ olùdarí ẹ̀ka onírúurú iṣẹ́ abẹ àti iṣẹ́ abẹ pàjáwìrì ní Ilé Ìwòsàn Bufalini ní Cesena, ó tún jẹ́ ààrẹ ẹgbẹ́ Italian Society of Surgical Physiopathology (SIFIPAC) “Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ti ràn wá lọ́wọ́ gan-an láti jẹ́ ká mọ ọgbọ́n tó túbọ̀ gbéṣẹ́ táá mú ká yẹra fún ìfàjẹ̀sínilára.
English: I feel a lot of backing from the recent legislative recognition in Italy with Law 219 of December 2017, ‘Provisions for informed consent and advance directives,’ where it states that ‘no health-care treatment can be initiated or continued without the person’s free and informed consent.’ If the surgeon communicates with the patient in a competent, free, and responsible way, there will surely be advantages for both in terms of sharing responsibilities, increasing the degree of freedom, and ultimately a more adequate and effective treatment path.”—Luca Ansaloni, director of general and emergency surgery unit at the Bufalini Hospital of Cesena, president of the Italian Society of Surgical Physiopathology (SIFIPAC) “Jehovah’s Witnesses have greatly contributed to the refinement of treatment strategies that avoid blood transfusions.

Yoruba: Wo àwòrán-olóhùn ráńpẹ́, Ìdí tí Ìlànà Ẹ̀kọ́ Ìṣísílẹ̀-gbangba fi Ṣe Kókó, kí o rí àwọn àǹfààní tí ó sojo sínú àwọn àṣẹ tí Creative Commons gbékalẹ̀ fún ètò ẹ̀kọ́.
English: Watch the brief video, Why Open Education Matters, to get a sense for the opportunities Creative Commons licenses create for education.

Yoruba: Dá a pa dà sí ìbẹ̀rẹ̀
English: Reset to defaults

Yoruba: “Ó fò sókè ó pẹ́ títí,” irọ́ ló ń pa.
English: “He jumped up and stayed aloft almost for ever”: that is a lie.

Yoruba: Tí wọ́n bá fẹ́ mú wa, kò ju kí wọ́n fi kọ̀ǹpútà wá àdírẹ́sì ibi tá a ti ń pè lórí fóònù.’
English: So if they want to, they can easily find us.’

Yoruba: Diego Costa ní ìgbàgbọ́ pé, jíjáwé olúborí Spain nínú ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ ọlọ́rẹ̀ẹ́jọ̀rẹ́ pẹ̀lú Argentina láìsí atamátàsé ọ̀hún, Messi nínú ikọ̀ náà ṣe àfihàn bí Messi ṣe ṣe pàtàkì fún Argentina tó.
English: Diego Costa believed that the victory of Spain in the friendly match with Argentina without the striker, Messi in the team shows how important Messi is to Argentina.

Yoruba: Àkótán àwọn àkọsílẹ̀ iṣẹ́
English: Summary logs

Yoruba: Pátá-pátá; là ń fọ́jú, kùm̀bọ̀-kumbọ là ń dẹ́tẹ̀; ojú à-fọ́-ì-fọ́-tán ìjà ní ń dá sílẹ̀.
English: One's blindness should be absolute, and one's leprosy should pervade the whole body; half-blindness only brings dissensions.

Yoruba: Àjọ tó ń rí si eré-ìdárayá bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà, NFF sọ pé, ìpàdé àwọn tọ́rọ̀ kàn gbọ̀ngbọ̀n nínú Àjọ tó ń rí sí bọ́ọ̀lù àfẹsẹ̀gbá lágbàáyé, FIFA yóò wáyé nílùú Ékó, lórílẹ̀-èdè Nàìjííríà, èyí tí yóò jẹ́ ìpàdé kejìlá irúfẹ́ ìpàdé ọ̀hún báyìí, 12 FIFA Executive Football Summit (EFS).
English: The Nigeria Football Federation has confirmed that FIFA will hold one of their 12 FIFA Executive Football Summit (EFS) meetings in Lagos, Nigeria.

Yoruba: Èyí kò dùn mọ́ ọ̀pọ̀ àwọn ọmọ ìlú nínú.
English: That doesn't sit well with citizens.

Yoruba: Ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà ò ní fi í sílẹ̀, àtàwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà tó lé ní ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì (200) tí wọ́n fẹ̀sùn ìwà ọ̀daràn kàn ní lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà.​—Sáàmù 27:1.
English: We are assured that Jehovah will continue to sustain him, as well as the more than 200 Jehovah’s Witnesses in Russia facing criminal charges.—Psalm 27:1.

Yoruba: Ọjọ́ tíìlùú bá ń lu onílù, iṣẹ́ mìíràn-án yá.
English: The day the drum begins to beat the drummer is the day he should seek another employment.

Yoruba: Ní April 2019, ìkẹ́kọ̀ọ́ Bíbélì tí wọ́n ṣe fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó ẹgbẹ̀rún lọ́nà ọgọ́rùn-ún méjì (195,600).
English: In April 2019, more than 195,600 Bible studies were being conducted.

Yoruba: Ayé ń lọ, à ń tọ̀ ọ́.
English: The world goes forth, and we follow.

Yoruba: Àwọn alábòójútó àyíká àti àwọn alàgbà ìjọ ń lọ bẹ àwọn tọ́rọ̀ náà kàn wò kí wọ́n lè fún wọn níṣìírí.
English: Circuit overseers and local elders are shepherding those affected by the storm.

Yoruba: Èròńgbà ìjọba Nàìjíríà láti ṣe àfikún ètò ìṣúná owó kò leè wá sí ìmúṣẹ nígbà tí ọ̀gọ̀rọ̀ àwọn agbègbè tí wọ́n fẹ́ kí wọ́n jẹ̀gbádùn àwọn mùdùnmúdùn wọ̀nyí ṣì ń dojúkọ ìdènà sí ìforúkọsílẹ̀.
English: The Nigerian government’s aim of financial inclusion cannot be met when many of the very communities they seek to include face barriers to registration.

Yoruba: Ibi tó jẹ́ ojúkò àgọ́ ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ ní Ravensbrück tó ti wá di ibi tí wọ́n ń kó àwọn nǹkan ìṣẹ̀ǹbáyé sí ti ṣe ètò kan tí wọ́n máa fi hàn ní àwọn ìlú káàkiri. Àkọlé ètò náà ni “Wọ́n Fòfin De Àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, Wọ́n sì Ṣe Inúnibíni sí Wọn ní Àgọ́ Ìṣẹ́niníṣẹ̀ẹ́ Ravensbrück àti Láwọn Ilé Ẹ̀wọ̀n Míì ní GDR.” Àfihàn náà jẹ́ ká rí bí wọ́n ṣe fìyà jẹ àwọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà ní Jámánì lábẹ́ ìjọba Násì (1933-1945), lábẹ́ ìjọba German Democratic Republic (ìyẹn GDR tàbí East Germany; lọ́dún 1949 sí 1990) àti lábẹ́ ìjọba Weimar Republic (lọ́dún 1918 sí 1933).
English: The Ravensbrück Memorial Site has organized a traveling exhibition entitled “Forbidden and Persecuted—Jehovah’s Witnesses in the Ravensbrück Concentration Camp and in the Penitentiaries of the GDR.” It highlights the difficulties that Jehovah’s Witnesses faced in Germany under the Nazi regime (1933-1945) and the German Democratic Republic (GDR or East Germany; 1949-1990), as well as the Weimar Republic (1918-1933).

Yoruba: O dẹ̀ la ẹnu sọ pé ìṣẹ́jú méta
English: And you even opened up your mouth to say three minutes

Yoruba: Aṣojú kan láti ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì tún bẹ àwọn ará tọ́rọ̀ kàn wò, ó sì fi ọ̀rọ̀ Ọlọ́run gbé wọn ró.
English: A branch representative also visited the affected brothers and provided spiritual encouragement.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, ìrètí yóò wà pé Ronald Koeman yóò ran ikọ̀ náà lọ́wọ́ láti pegedé fún ìdíje Euro 2020, bákan náà ìdíje àgbááyé ọdún 2022 lórílẹ̀-èdè Qatar.
English: He will be expected to help the Dutch qualify for Euro 2020 and the World Cup in Qatar two years thereafter, reviving the team’s fortunes in the process.

Yoruba: Ẹní bá ríkun nímú ọlọ́jà ní ń fọn ọ́n.
English: Whoever sees mucus in the nose of the king is the one who cleans it.

English: Invited Branches: Argentina, Belgium, Bolivia, Central America, Colombia, Cuba, Kazakhstan, Korea, Moldova, Myanmar, Poland, Spain, United States

Yoruba: Ẹnìkan lára àwọn tí a fọ̀rọ̀ wá lẹ́nu wò sọ pé "Bẹ́ẹ̀ ni, àwọn ilé ìfowópamọ́sí ní ọ̀rọ̀ alálàyé-aṣàfihàn nípaà mi... àwọn Àjọ tó ń ṣàkóso Èbúté Omi ní orílẹ̀-èdèe Nàìjíríà náà ń rí ọ̀rọ̀ alálàyé-aṣàfihàn nípa wa".
English: One interviewee stated, “Yes, banks have access to my information... and Nigeria Ports Authority have access to our information”.

Yoruba: A kì í dá ẹrù ikùn pa orí.
English: One does not weigh the head down with a load that belongs to the belly.

Yoruba: Àgbàdo kì í ṣe èèyàn; ta ní ń rí ọmọ lẹ́yìn eèsún.
English: The maize plant is not human; who ever saw children on the back of elephant grass?

Yoruba: Ọ̀-jẹ-wọ̀mù-wọ̀mù-kú-wọ̀mù-wọ̀mù lorúkọ tí àpà ń jẹ́.
English: One-who-eats-recklessly-and-dies-recklessly is the name one calls a wasteful person.

Yoruba: Ní báyìí ná, ó dá wa lójú pé Jèhófà máa bù kún gbogbo ìsapá wọn láti rí i pé ìhìn rere Ìjọba Ọlọ́run dé àwọn ibi tó jìnnà jù lọ lápá àríwá orílẹ̀-èdè Kánádà, tó jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára ibi tó jìnnà jù lọ ní ayé!​—Ìṣe 1:8.
English: In the meantime, we know that Jehovah will bless their diligent efforts to bring the good news to the northernmost regions of Canada—one of the most distant parts of the earth!—Acts 1:8.

Yoruba: Nínú ìwẹ́ àtẹ̀jáde tí àarẹ Muhammadu Buhari kọ sí orílẹ̀ èdè méjéèjì náà, ààrẹ ni": “orílẹ̀ èdè Nàíjíríà ba ẹyin ati àwọn ènìyàn ti ìjàm̀bá omíyalé àti ilẹ̀ rírì náà sẹlẹ̀ sí kẹ́dùn púpọ̀"
English: Buhari noted that “emergency management response is one of Africa’s biggest challenges of development, and we should work together to find a common strategy to minimise the human and economic impacts of these catastrophes.”

Yoruba: Oyetola ní, ohun jẹ́ kí ètò ìṣúná náà wà ní ìbámu pẹ̀lú bí ètò ọrọ̀ ajé ìpínlẹ̀ náà se rí lásìkò yìí, lọ́nà àtimú ètò ìsúná náà wá sí ìmúsẹ.
English: Oyetola, who described the size of the budget as the most realistic, said the government would stop at nothing to ensure its full implementation.

English: Severe Flooding Causes Devastation in Eastern Spain

English: So, tell me, how many policemen do you think are on this taxi?

English: Despite the government’s goals of financial inclusion and aid distribution, our research shows that these IDs have not reached many people in rural areas in need of aid.

English: The traditional ruler commended Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu, Chairman Lagos Mainland Local government Mr Omolola Essien and Mr. Oladele Adekanye for their support for the programme.

Yoruba: Olóòlà kì í kọ àfín.

Yoruba: Ẹ̀ka ọ́fíìsì wa ní Ọsirélíà ròyìn pé akéde méjìdínlọ́gọ́ta (58) láti ìjọ mẹ́ta ni omíyalé yìí mú kí wọ́n lọ máa gbé lọ́dọ̀ àwọn mọ̀lẹ́bí wọn tàbí àwọn ará.
English: The Australasia branch reports that, as a result of the flooding, 58 publishers from three congregations needed to relocate to the homes of family members or other Witnesses.

English: If one has never hunted, one would not know the tracks of “it-did-not-go-that-way.”

Yoruba: Àdúrà wa ni pé kí Jèhófà wà pẹ̀lú Arákùnrin Dennis Christensen àti ìyàwó rẹ̀. Kó sì tún dúró ti gbogbo àwọn ará wa lórílẹ̀-èdè Rọ́ṣíà.—1 Pétérù 3:12.
English: We will continue to pray that Jehovah give his unfailing support to Dennis Christensen, his wife, and all of our fellow worshippers throughout Russia.—1 Peter 3:12.

Yoruba: Ẹ mọ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀?
English: You know that?

Yoruba: Mi ò fẹnukonu

Yoruba: Àràbà ńlá fojú di àáké.
